intro: Duroia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically leathery and glossy, providing a habitat for various epiphytic organisms. Duroia longiflora is often found growing on tree trunks or branches in the canopy layer of the rainforest.
